metadata.title: CVE-2014-1728 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google Chrome before 34.0.1847.116allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impactvia unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1728` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-browser-l10n - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-chromedriver - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2').
